intro: Craepaloprumnon rubicundum, commonly known as the crimson flame shrub, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant red and orange flowers that bloom throughout the summer months. The plant has a dense, bushy growth habit with dark green, glossy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a decorative plant.
